did.unittitle: Series XXXIV: Washington Terminal Co. Railroad: Washington D.C. Union Station and Potomac Yards

scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of the Washington Terminal Company's facilities in Washington D.C . These photographs were submitted to the Commission as Employees' Exhibit 38, are referred to by the letter A in testimony, and were taken by Leo R. Anderson. Mr. Anderson was employed as a locomotive fireman by the WATC. The WATC is a corporation created in Washington D.C. to provide support to railroads using Washington's Union Station. It was established in 1901 by the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad and the Pennsylvania Railroad; Amtrak now owns the controlling interest. The photographs in this series document the tracks in and around Washington Union Station, showing the complexity of train movements in the area. The series also documents the Potomac Yards and the car shops at Ivy City.

Northbound movement out of Track 4, Express Warehouse showing switch target and fixed signal. To the left are Tracks 3, 2, and 1 express warehouse. This lead out of the warehouse proceeds into a main running track used by inbound and outbound passenger trains.
Passenger terminal, electrified. Note overhead wires and close clearances of tracks.

Northbound movement out of Track 4, Express Warehouse showing switch target and fixed signal. To the left are Tracks 3, 2, and 1 express warehouse. This lead out of the warehouse proceeds into a main running track used by inbound and outbound passenger trains.

did.unittitle: Washington DC Union Station, Passenger Terminal

scopecontent.p: Passenger terminal, electrified. Note overhead wires and close clearances of tracks. Railway Express warehouse to right of frame.

did.unittitle: Washington DC Union Station, Passenger Terminal

scopecontent.p: Passenger terminal, electrified. Note overhead wires and close clearances of tracks. Railway Express warehouse to right of frame.

did.unittitle: West Yard of Washington Terminal Railroad

scopecontent.p: Washington DC Union Station, passenger terminal in background

did.unittitle: View from H Bridge in West Yard, Looking South

scopecontent.p: H Bridge, southbound, showing West Yard B&O Side Tracks 1 to 9, E Bridge Tracks 12 to 15 inclusive. K interlocking tower in left background. Picture also indicates the large amount of interlocking switches and cross-overs in this area. All movements through this location are governed by K interlocking tower.

did.unittitle: Washington DC Union Station, Passenger Terminal

scopecontent.p: Shows train movements in and about the K interlocking tower, and H and J bridges. The B&O, PRR, RFP, C&O, and Southern railroads use these facilities for their operation in the terminal area. (similar to A-22a)

did.unittitle: Washington DC Union Station, Passenger Terminal

scopecontent.p: B&O Unit #1450, EMD E-8-A

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Shows the signals at the right of the locomotive in a slow-clear position. Location is northbound tube with fixed signal in a slow clear position, which is observed by firemen who in return, relays signal indication to enginemen.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Proceeding into north and southbound tubes and reverse movement showing signals as observed by firemen located on left side of locomotive. Proceeding southbound on track No. 26, lower level Union Station concourse. Close clearance at points left of track where employees have to work in and about in performance of their duties necessitating the constant look-out by fireman doing the movement of the train.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Proceeding southbound on track No. 26, lower level Union Station concourse. Showing signals as observed by firemen located on left side of locomotive. Picture indicates approaching into cross-overs dividing the north and southbound tubes.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level Approaching Fan Chamber

scopecontent.p: Picture shows passing fan chamber. Headlight of another locomotive in the southbound tube can only be observed by fireman from his position on left side of locomotive. If the movement had to use the same track, only firemen could pass warning signal to enginemen. Also note close clearance from abutments.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Proceeding in reverse movement into tubes, showing signals as observed by firemen located on left side of locomotive. Picture shows indication of next signal being observed only by the firemen. Signal on left side which would govern reverse movement is shown later.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Shows the signals at the right of the locomotive in a slow-clear position. Location is northbound tube with fixed signal in a slow clear position, which is observed by firemen who in return, relays signal indication to enginemen.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Shows track curvature under the Union Station concourse lower level. Proceeding northbound into track which leads to track 29, 28, or 27. Note curvature of track, also signal governing movement beyond the double curve.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Northbound picture showing curvature of track, also leads and interlocking switches govern the movement 29, 28 and 27 respectively. To the right of the picture is the walkway where passengers board trains.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Shows a reverse movement under the Union Station concourse lower level. Signal on right hand pedestal in stop position. Observation of this signal by firemen on left side of locomotive. Close clearances in and about other tracks. High tension wires carrying 11,000 volts are pictured overhead.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Shows a reverse movement in the north and southbound tubes. Southbound movement out of Track 29 with the next signal in stop position and due to the curvature in the track, observation is by firemen on left side of locomotive.

did.unittitle: Under the Union Station Concourse Lower Level, North and Southbound Tubes

scopecontent.p: Picture shows southward direction Track 26 showing close clearances and passage ways where employees must pass through. Firemen must be on constant look-out to protect employees.

did.unittitle: North End of Car Shop, View to South Showing Tracks 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10

scopecontent.p: Yard switching in this area has many hazardous features. Views obstructed by jacks, wheels, wheelbarrows, small carts and trucks and other items used by repairmen. Observation of obstruction in and about tracks in this area necessitates a constant look-out by the firemen on the left side of the engine for the safety of the employees in and about the shop area.
Curvature of track and close clearance, constant look-out of firemen is needed to protect the employees working in and around shop area.

did.unittitle: Railway Express Warehouse Looking North with Cars in Track 6 to the Right and Cars in Track 5 to the Left

scopecontent.p: Engine working this warehouse area is headed north. Fireman's vision from left side of locomotive protects movement of said cars when any obstructions are in and around the car area. Trucks in picture must be cleared to prevent collisions and accidents.

did.unittitle: Railway Express Warehouse, Track No. 6 Looking North

scopecontent.p: Showing curvature of track, location of switch target, also derail target which is observed from the left side of the locomotive.

did.unittitle: Railway Express Warehouse, Track No. 4 Northbound

scopecontent.p: Northbound movement out of Track 4, Express Warehouse showing switch target and fixed signal. To the left are Tracks 3, 2, and 1 express warehouse. This lead out of the warehouse proceeds into a main running track used by inbound and outbound passenger trains.

The light signal to the left of the pole is positioned low to the ground. In the center of the picture, there is a fixed signal that is in the stop position, governing all southbound movements. To the extreme right is a yard-switching locomotive with one car, proceeding south.
B&O car with engine being moved on turntable. In the center of the picture toward the bottom is a fixed signal in the stopped position, which the fireman observes on the left side of the engine.

did.unittitle: View from H Bridge in West Yard, Looking South

scopecontent.p: Taken from H Bridge, showing the West Yard B&O Side Tracks 1 through 9 and E Bridge Tracks 12 through 15. Along with the K Interlocking Tower photograph, this photo indicates the large amount of interlocking switches and crossovers in this area. All movements through this location are governed by the K interlocking tower.
Shows close clearances and track curvature in the industries of the west yard.

did.unittitle: View from H Bridge of Tracks in West Yard

scopecontent.p: Shows the intricacies of train movements in the west yard. Notice the many switches and crossovers.

did.unittitle: View from H Bridge of Tracks in West Yard

scopecontent.p: Shows the intricacies of train movements in the west yard. Notice the many switches and crossovers.

did.unittitle: View of West Yard Tracks, Southern Railroad Passenger Car on Right

scopecontent.p: Shows train movements in and about the K interlocking tower, as well as H and J bridges. The B&O, PRR, RFP, C&O, and Southern railroads use these facilities for their operation in the terminal area.

did.unittitle: Under New York Avenue Bridge, Looking West

scopecontent.p: This shows close clearances and switches which are observed by the fireman and called to the engineman.

did.unittitle: View of B&O Main Line Passenger Tracks, Facing South

scopecontent.p: Used by the main line B&O passenger trains, cross-over tracks for yard use, with overhead wires. To the left, the tracks are used by the Pennsylvania Railroad inbound and outbound trains. In the upper-middle part of the picture, the signal bridge "L" governs the north and southbound movements.
The picture is taken looking east with the shop area running north and south.
Picture shown with two yard switches pushing cars over the Hump in a southward movement. View taken from Route 1.

did.unittitle: Potomac Yards, Classification Yard and RFP Main Lines

scopecontent.p: On the left is a full view of the classification yards. To the right is a southern view of the main lines used by the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad with a fixed position signal in view.

did.unittitle: Potomac Yards, Classification Yard and RFP Main Lines

scopecontent.p: On the right are the Potomac Yards and hump tracks. To the left are the northbound and southbound main lines used by the Richmond, Fredericksburg and Potomac Railroad.
